hints.content: To divide a shape in half, we divide the whole into **$2$ equal parts**.

This rectangle is divided into $4$ parts:  

![A rectangle with 1 horizontal line and 1 vertical line dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3beb6d0b19b0f25cd9cd5c85599073e23a93d5f3)

This rectangle is divided into $2$ pieces, but the pieces are not  equal in size:  

![A rectangle has a vertical line dividing it into 2 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cf31fff9ec9fe45cb8bfed9d661f093ecb3695b0)

These rectangles are divided into halves:  

![A rectangle with 1 diagonal line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/961cfad82c3629505dc8640dc1e55732c6979519)

![A rectangle with 1 horizontal line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/319428aac2a57457228c856860dcbb4fc7c5051a)

question.content:
**Which rectangles are divided into halves?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A rectangle has a vertical line dividing it into 2 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cf31fff9ec9fe45cb8bfed9d661f093ecb3695b0)
![A rectangle with 1 diagonal line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/961cfad82c3629505dc8640dc1e55732c6979519)
![A rectangle with 1 horizontal line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/319428aac2a57457228c856860dcbb4fc7c5051a)
![A rectangle with 1 horizontal line and 1 vertical line dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3beb6d0b19b0f25cd9cd5c85599073e23a93d5f3)
